Cancer: I would cure cancer first because it is one of the most devastating diseases that affects millions of people worldwide. The emotional toll of cancer on individuals and their families is immense. Curing cancer would bring immense joy and relief to countless people and their loved ones.

Malaria: Malaria is a deadly disease that affects millions of people, particularly in developing countries. Curing malaria would have a significant impact on global health and would save countless lives.

Alzheimer's Disease: Alzheimer's disease is a debilitating condition that affects millions of people worldwide. Curing Alzheimer's disease would improve the quality of life for those affected and their families, as well as reduce the burden on healthcare systems.

Infectious Diseases: Infectious diseases such as HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, and hepatitis B and C affect millions of people worldwide. Curing these diseases would have a significant impact on global health and would save countless lives.

Mental Health Disorders: Mental health disorders such as depression, anxiety, and bipolar disorder affect millions of people worldwide. Curing these disorders would improve the quality of life for those affected and their families, as well as reduce the burden on healthcare systems.
